thread.title: A mind-set for violence

author: John Woodrow Cox
title: A mind-set for violence
text:
People look at guns during the Nation's Gun Show at the Dulles Expo Center in Chantilly on Oct. 3. (Jabin Botsford/The Washington Post) October 19 at 5:19 PM Regarding Evan DeFilippis and Devin Hughes’s Oct. 16 op-ed, “ Gun safety’s middle ground ”:
Background checks for gun purchases are fine, but they miss the point somewhat. What really causes gun violence: the mind or the gun? Every gun incident makes politicians point to gun control as the answer. Some U.S. cities where restrictions make gun ownership difficult still rank high in rates of murders by guns. Trying to stop guns is like trying to stop drugs; it has not worked.
Perhaps the president should look at the mind-set of a person who pulls the trigger. Unfortunately, we are bombarded by movies and video games that show guns, violence, death and explosions. For some, the mind becomes numb to this violence.
The next time there is a nationally publicized shooting, we as a nation should also point the finger at those making a profit on promoting violence in entertainment.
Christopher Lapp , Great Falls
